greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Distance of 2n from the closest prime.
example: n=13, 2n=26 surrounded by 23 and 29 which are from 26 in equal distance of 3 and min{3,3}=3=a(13).
mathematica: a[n_] := Min[NextPrime[2*n] - 2*n, 2*n - NextPrime[2*n, -1]]; Array[a, 100, 2] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 16 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = min(2*n - precprime(2*n-1), nextprime(2*n+1) - 2*n); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 16 2020
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 23 2001
